definition: "silk" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 120), occurring in 红, 绿, 累 etc/also pr. [mi4]
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
lit. lacking the strength even to truss a chicken (idiom)/fig. weak/unaccustomed to physical work
pinyin: shou3 wu2 fu4 ji1 zhi1 li4

definition: to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist with his own petard
palm fiber/rope of palm fiber/coir (coconut fiber)
to bind oneself hand and foot
to surrender after baring oneself to the waist and tying one's hands behind
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist with his own petard

sentences.english: The cylinder head is attached to the block with high-tensile steel studs.
sentences.chinese: 气缸盖与气缸体用高强度的钢螺栓缚连结。

sentences.english: Otherwise, the target teleports but is still immobilized or restrained when it reaches the destination space.
sentences.chinese: 否则，目标在传送后依然定身或受缚。

sentences.english: Moisten the tower with cold water and apply it to the wound.
sentences.chinese: 把毛巾用冷水浸湿，缚在伤口处。

sentences.english: Moisten the towel with cold water and apply it to the wound.
sentences.chinese: 把毛巾用冷水浸湿，缚在伤口处。

sentences.english: I did but tie one fellow, who was taken red-handed in the fact, to the horns of a wild stag.
sentences.chinese: 我把一个当场抓获的家伙缚在一只野鹿的角上。

sentences.english: Tie them to the saddle-bow: very slack so that I can do what I like with my head.
sentences.chinese: 要缚得十分宽松，让我的脑袋可以自由活动。

sentences.english: Shanghang County Dragon Boat Festival with boat tie-shaped reed plays Zuolong waterfront, known as the Boat Race.
sentences.chinese: 上杭县端午用小艇缚芦苇作龙形戏于水滨，称为竞渡。

sentences.english: He was bound apprentice to a tailor.
sentences.chinese: 他受缚做为裁缝师的学徒。

sentences.english: Alternately, you can commission a spiritualist at your home point to revive you for a minor experience point penalty.
sentences.chinese: 可以委托起始点的缚灵者复活，带有少量经验惩罚。

sentences.english: Of the tribe of Naphtali， Nahbi the son of Vophsi.
sentences.chinese: 属拿弗他利支派的有缚西的儿子拿比。

definition: many things arranged together, or connected together/to go on limitlessly
cage used to hold or transport prisoners
cangue (wooden collar like stocks used to restrain and punish criminals in China)
a legendary dragon with the ability to control rain and floods/see also 蛟龍|蛟龙[jiao1 long2]
